text: hi! does HubSpot have project management and billing and invoice features?

I don’t think so. I’ve seen some HubSpot invoice generator thing before but I think that’s more about designing an invoice look.

Project management wise most of us on here use one of the following tools: Basecamp, Notion, jira, asana, there’s a few other big ones I’m forgetting

Closest you can get to billing is our integration with Stripe <https://www.HubSpot.com/integrations/stripe>.  We also do have a projects tool <https://www.HubSpot.com/products/marketing/projects> but it’s not super robust to be honest and most people use one of the tools Jon mentioned

Taking Jon's method of suggesting Ideas.
Idea - in a basic form module, have a way to disable / unset the form
Scenario - using the same template for a "Thank You" page. No need to show any form there.
I think you can de select the form at the page level by setting it to the top most value - usually something like “select a form” it may display a placeholder form though not sure
I usually add a boolean when I need to do that, because usually the lack of the form is supposed to alter the layout a little anyways.
